snippet: The government is changing the terms of its bailout agreement with Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to shrink the holdings of the two mortgage giants more quickly.
abstract: Treasury Department will change the terms of its bailout agreement with Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to shrink the holdings of the two mortgage giants more quickly, and will require payment to the government of all quarterly profits the companies earn.
lead_paragraph: The government is changing the terms of its bailout agreement with Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to shrink the holdings of the two mortgage giants more quickly.

headline.main: U.S. Hastens Shrinkage of Mortgage Firms’ Portfolios
headline.print_headline: U.S. Hastens Shrinkage of Mortgage Firms’ Portfolios

keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
